// Source: configWithUnquotedString{}
//
// Generated by this command:
//
//	go-options -quote-default-strings=false -namespace=UnquotedOptionNs -option=UnquotedOption configWithUnquotedString
//

package test

import "fmt"

import "github.com/google/go-cmp/cmp"

type ApplyUnquotedOptionFunc func(c *configWithUnquotedString) error

func (f ApplyUnquotedOptionFunc) apply(c *configWithUnquotedString) error {
	return f(c)
}

func newConfigWithUnquotedString(options ...UnquotedOption) (configWithUnquotedString, error) {
	var c configWithUnquotedString
	err := applyConfigWithUnquotedStringOptions(&c, options...)
	return c, err
}

func applyConfigWithUnquotedStringOptions(c *configWithUnquotedString, options ...UnquotedOption) error {
	c.myString = "quoted"
	for _, o := range options {
		if err := o.apply(c); err != nil {
			return err
		}
	}
	return nil
}

type UnquotedOption interface {
	apply(*configWithUnquotedString) error
}

type unquotedOptionNamespace struct{}

var UnquotedOptionNs unquotedOptionNamespace

type unquotedOptionMyStringImpl struct {
	o string
}

func (o unquotedOptionMyStringImpl) apply(c *configWithUnquotedString) error {
	c.myString = o.o
	return nil
}

func (o unquotedOptionMyStringImpl) Equal(v unquotedOptionMyStringImpl) bool {
	switch {
	case !cmp.Equal(o.o, v.o):
		return false
	}
	return true
}

func (o unquotedOptionMyStringImpl) String() string {
	name := "MyString"

	// hack to avoid go vet error about passing a function to Sprintf
	var value interface{} = o.o
	return fmt.Sprintf("%s: %+v", name, value)
}

func (unquotedOptionNamespace) MyString(o string) UnquotedOption {
	return unquotedOptionMyStringImpl{
		o: o,
	}
}
